p: Where the numerator of V is averaged over the moving window. If t has units of years and T is °C (or mm, for annual precipitation), the units for V are yr -1 ( V for annual precipitation has the same units), which may be interpreted as the factor by which partnership area needs to increase in order to maintain the current climate space over time ( Fig 2). Furthermore, because σ(T) is calculated with respect to area, A (e.g., km 2), the denominator of V could also be σ(T)/ A, and V would have units of km 2/yr (i.e., the area equivalent of climate change velocity, km/yr). Comparing σ(T)/ A under partnerships ( r > 0 km) vs. the null model ( r = 0 km), the denominator could also be Δσ(T) /ΔA.
